title: Medical Devices Firm Boosts U.S. Thrombectomy Growth Forecast | PEN Stock News
text:
A leading medical devices company has adjusted its growth forecast for its U.S. Thrombectomy franchise. The company is now projecting a year-over-year growth rate of 20% to 21%, an increase from the previously anticipated 19% to 20%. This optimistic revision underscores the firm's confidence in the market potential and demand for its thrombectomy products.
In addition to the growth forecast, the company remains committed to its financial targets for the upcoming years. It has reiterated its guidance for gross margin expansion, expecting an increase of at least 100 basis points in 2025. This will push the gross margin to exceed 67% for the entire year. Furthermore, the company maintains its projection for operating margin expansion, aiming for a range between 13% and 14% of revenue by the end of 2025.
These financial projections reflect the company's strategic initiatives to enhance profitability and market share in the medical device industry. Investors and stakeholders may find these developments critical as the company seeks to solidify its position in the competitive healthcare sector.

Key Business Developments
Release Date: February 18, 2025
- Revenue: $321.3 million for Q4 2024, a 12.9% increase year over year on an adjusted basis.
- Full Year Revenue: Over $1.2 billion, a 13.4% increase year over year.
- US Thrombectomy Sales: $180.6 million for Q4 2024, a 27.3% increase year over year.
- Gross Margin: 67.4% for Q4 2024, a 170 basis point increase from the prior year period.
- Operating Income: $48.6 million for Q4 2024, representing 15.1% of revenue.
- Operating Cash Flow: $49.1 million generated in Q4 2024.
- Adjusted EBITDA: $63.7 million for Q4 2024, 19.8% of total revenue.
- Cash and Equivalents: $340.1 million at the end of Q4 2024, with no debt.
- International Revenue Decline: 9.4% decrease in Q4 2024, primarily due to a decline in China revenue.
- Full Year Thrombectomy Revenue: $818.1 million, a 20.8% increase year over year.
For the complete transcript of the earnings call, please refer to the full earnings call transcript.
Positive Points
- Penumbra Inc (
PEN,Financial) reported a strong revenue growth of 12.9% year over year for Q4 2024, reaching $321.3 million, with a 13% growth on a constant currency basis. - The US thrombectomy business showed significant growth, with sales increasing by 27.3% year over year, driven by a 41% growth in the US VTE franchise.
- Penumbra Inc (PEN) introduced nine new products to the US market, including advancements in their CAVT portfolio, which contributed to their strong market position.
- The company achieved a gross margin of 67.4% in Q4 2024, an improvement of 170 basis points from the previous year, indicating strong profitability.
- Penumbra Inc (PEN) is on track to achieve a gross margin profile over 70% by the end of 2026, supported by favorable product mix and operational efficiencies.
Negative Points
- International revenue declined by 9.4% adjusted and 9.1% in constant currency, primarily due to a significant decrease in China revenue.
- The company faced a $5.8 million reserve related to Italian payback legislation, impacting financial results.
- Penumbra Inc (PEN) experienced a one-time $33.4 million Immersive Healthcare inventory write-off, affecting the gross margin for the year.
- The guidance for 2025 revenue growth is set at 12% to 14%, which some analysts questioned given the headwinds faced in 2024.
- The company has not yet submitted the Thunderbolt technology for FDA approval, which could impact future growth projections.
